I got to illustrate a book cover about a bookstore in Tuscany!! It's all the things I love rolled into one! The book is calle "Diary of a Tuscan Bookshop" by @alba_donaty
The book is about Alba opening a "tiny but enchanting bookshop in a lovely little cottage on a hill.... After surviving a fire and pandemic restrictions, the “Bookshop on the Hill” soon became a refuge and destination for an ever-growing community.... it has become a literary destination, with many devoted readers coming from afar to browse, enjoy a cup of tea, and find comfort in the knowledge that Alba will find the perfect read for them." (S&S website). 📚🇮🇹🌳
I got to work with the lovely @jayam66 on this cover, who I met- you guessed it- in a bookstore!

Recently, I took a break from looking at birds. It was getting hard to teach, do freelance and also take 2-hour bird walks each day. The break has been good, as it helped me rediscover how beautiful NYC is! Here is Chinatown, a really beautiful part of the city. (But still had to include a bird!) 
I have also been reconnecting with my work, sketching more and in different styles and spending more time drawing with other people and looking at art. Thanks to @dasbrooklyn for this fancy @archespapers sketchbook!

I never liked the holidays until I moved to New York city. I simply adore all the lights and decorations that cover the city, from the fancy ones on Madison avenue to the cheapy ones in a dirty deli. They all make me feel so happy! Nothing better than to sit in a diner and look out at at a dark gloomy street through a portal of lights and tinsle. ✨🏵️✨

February is Black History Month! Here is my tribute to wonderful artist I love Loïs Mailou Jones, seen here with her studio kitty! Scroll to see her and some of her beautiful works.
🖌️🎨
Born in 1905, Jones graduated from Boston’s School of the Museum of Fine Arts. She founded the art department at Palmer Memorial Institute in North Carolina, then later taught art at Howard University in Washington, D.C. and was also commissioned by the US Information Agency to serve as a cultural ambassador to Africa.
Read more about her here: https://nmwa.org/art/artists/lois-mailou-jones/
And Here: https://www.illustrationhistory.org/artists/lois-mailou-jones

Woodcocks are in town! 🐦‍⬛ and they are very prone to window collisions. Here is a painting of @soft.slow.dull , a volunteer at @wildbirdfund lovingly taking care of a woodcock that collided with a window. Learn how to get bird proof glass (@americanbirdconservancy has good advice on this!) And if you find an injured bird in the city you can contact the Wild Bird Fund for help! 🐦‍⬛🐦🐦‍⬛
This painting was part of a story I did for @newyorkermag about the Wild Bird Fund last year

Who’s coming to paint in Italy with me this Fall? (Part 2!)🎨🖌️🇮🇹 I’m collaborating with the amazing Danielle Oteri from @feastonhistory to bring you an artist retreat in Southern Italy, the most magical place on earth. 
The retreat will run October 15-22 2023.  We will stay at the amazing @borgolapietraia_countryhouse and soak up inspiration from the Cilento Coast.
We will paint, eat, drink wine, and learn about the history and art of the region. No prior art experience needed, just the desire to draw, paint and enjoy beautiful things! Click the link in my bio for more info and to register! Ciao! 🎨🖌️🇮🇹

Spring migration is at its peak right now, and you can find some amazing birds in some unusual places. This illustration for @indymonthly about birdwatching was inspired by the time I took my students to draw at the library in midtown, and one of my students saw a Black Throated Green warbler on the rooftop of the library. He took a picture and we identified it together. I love spreading my love of birds! ✨🕊️ Big thanks to AD Margo! Story by a Michelle Mastro

On July 4th I like to post this project I did in 2016 when I asked people what "Democracy" means to them. We have to keep fighting for it now more than ever, for those spending this holiday in for-profit prisons, evicted or priced out of their homes, with lack of drinkable water, surrounded by pollution and wildfires, and all other things we can change if we work together, fearlessly, against greed and corruption.

Announcing the dates of our Spring 2024 Italian retreat: join us May 19-26 2024!  🇮🇹
@feastonhistory and I are currently leading our Fall tours here in the Cilento coast, the spring tour will have the same things: painting, drawing, art history, food and wine, and even birds! 🐦🖌️
Click the link in my bio for more details, and I hope to see you there! ⛵
This painting is of @parcoarcheologicopaestum , one of the amazing places we will be visiting and sketching (we were just there on Monday!!) . It features Greek temples from  about 550 to 450 BC, unbelievable ancient paintings, and the energy there is otherworldly.

I just finished 2 dreamy weeks of teaching art retreats at the @borgolapietraia
In southern Italy. The groups were so amazing! We also got to learn about the region from some incredible guides. This is Mario, who specializes in the ancient temples of @parcoarcheologicopaestum . He told us the wildest stories of ancient Roman and Greek times, and I think everyone got a little crush on him. You can learn about the temples from Mario in Spring 2024 on our next retreat ! The dates are May 19-26 2024!  🇮🇹

One of my new year's resolutions is to be a better, more mindful cook. I was inspired by amazing chef @mario_stellato_ who is the chef at the resort @borgolapietraia , where my Italian art retreat is based. 
Everything Mario makes is like a beautiful poem, and you can taste the careful thought and great knowledge that went into it. 🍅🥖🍽️
Come on my art retreat in May with @feastonhistory you'll get to take a cooking class with Mario, and of course eat amazing food every day at the Borgo!
